div.class: clearfix text-formatted field field--name-body field--type-text-with-summary field--label-hidden field__item

p.strong: temporarily working remotely; continuing to serve members
p.br: OSBA will conduct mandatory remote operations (MRO) until May 4. While the MRO is in effect, all staff will be equipped to perform their duties from home, and members will be able to contact them via phone or email. OSBA also is canceling all in-person meetings and workshops from March 13 to May 1. This is in response to an Ohio Department of Health order that limits mass gatherings and the stay-at-home order. OSBA is continuing to monitor guidance at the state and federal level related to this and will share more information as it is available.

div.p: If you need assistance, please contact OSBA at (614) 540-4000 or (800) 589-OSBA. Staff members can be reached by their office phone numbers and email addresses or by calling the main office phone numbers above.

li.a: Information for Ohio schools and districts

ul.li: View a recent communication from ODE reminding school staff and administrators to review their school safety plans, which should incorporate hazards such as widespread flu and pandemic disease outbreaks.
You can learn more about school safety plans at the Ohio School Safety Center's website.
U.S. Department of Education COVID-19 Information and Resources for Schools and School Personnel

p.br: The Ohio Department of Health, in coordination with the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), is closely monitoring coronavirus disease 2019, first identified in Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.

li.a: ODH coronavirus resources

ul.li: Find your local health district, which can provide guidance and advice at the local level.
Access resources for the public, including how to prevent the spread of infectious diseases.
Download an FAQ, developed March 2, 2020 with the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
View CDC interim guidance for administrators of U.S. child care programs and K-12 schools to plan, prepare and respond to coronavirus and caring for children.
Ohio’s Open Meetings Act Under the COVID-19 Emergency Declaration: Frequently Asked Questions (April 6, 2020)
Coronavirus FAQ: To All Local Governments, Public Offices and IPAs (updated March 25, 2020)

Ohio Department of Health Amended Order on the Closure of All K-12 Schools in the State of Ohio (March 30, 2020)
original order: Ohio Department of Health Order on the Closure of All K-12 School in the State of Ohio (March 14, 2020)

Ohio Department of Health Amended stay-at-home order (April 2, 2020)
Ohio Department of Health stay-at-home order (March 22, 2020)
Gov. Mike DeWine Executive Order 2020-01D declaring a state of emergency (March 9, 2020)
OHSAA cancels spring season as school facilities to remain closed (April 21, 2020)
Administrator Update (April 8, 2020)
Administrator Update (March 31, 2020
Administrator Update (March 20, 2020)
Memo to Schools (March 19, 2020)
Families First Coronavirus Response Act FAQ covers the law's impact on student meals and leave for school employees

NSBA worked with the National Association of School Nurses to create a guide, "COVID-19: Preparing For Widespread Illness in Your School Community: A Legal Guide for School Leaders." This resource can help preparedness efforts. The steps to prevention and mitigation, preparedness, response, and recovery highlight key actions that can guide local efforts.
NSBA's website has compiled resources and articles on the coronavirus.

In addition to communication resources available to its members, NSPRA is offering two resources on coronavirus crisis communication response free to the public through a partnership between NSPRA and Blackboard.
Download the Coronavirus Communications Crisis for Public Schools guide (PDF), which offers 10 tips for COVID-19 communications, important words to know, expert resources and communication examples from several public schools.
Watch the Communicating COVID-19 webinar recording, which features a panel of five notable school PR experts sharing tips and advice for how to effectively manage communications about the new coronavirus disease.
The NSPRA website has additional resources shared by those in the health industry, governmental organizations and news outlets.
Mental Health America - Mental Health And COVID-19 – Information And Resources
The Collaborative for Academic, Social, and Emotional Learning (CASEL) - Social-emotional learning resources for parents, educators and state policymakers during COVID-19
National Cyber Security Alliance - COVID-19 Security Resource Library

div.class: clearfix text-formatted field field--name-body field--type-text-with-summary field--label-hidden field__item
div.p: OSBA leads the way to educational excellence by serving Ohio’s public school board members and the diverse districts they represent through superior service, unwavering advocacy and creative solutions.

div.class: clearfix text-formatted field field--name-body field--type-text-with-summary field--label-hidden field__item
div.p:
Ohio School Boards Association
8050 N. High St., Suite 100
Columbus, OH 43235
(614) 540-4000 | (800) 589-OSBA
Fax: (614) 540-4100 | Send us feedback
